Preheat oven to 350° F.
Lightly grease two 9 x 5-inch loaf pans.
In a large bowl, using an electric mixer, beat sugar and vegetable oil to blend.
Add in eggs, one at a time, then vanilla, mixing after each addition.
Add in the banana and stir to combine.
In another large bowl, whisk together flours, cinnamon, baking soda, baking powder and salt.
Stir flour mixture into banana mixture in 2 or 3 additions until just combined.
Gently fold in blueberries.
Spoon batter evenly into loaf pans, filling about 3/4 of the way to the top of each pan.
Bake in preheated oven for 60 – 70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the middle of a loaf comes out clean.
Cool loaf pans on wire racks for 10 minutes.
Remove loaves from pans, place on racks and cool completely.

Pull the leaves from cauliflower.
Cut the core out in a kind of cone-shaped section.
Break a wok or cut into regular about 1.5 inch pieces.
Put the wows in the steamer insert.
Bring about 1 inch of water to a boil, add the insert, cover and cook for about 20 minutes. You can poke a paring knife through the stem, or until you still can feel a little texture in the steaming pot.
Dump about half of the cauliflower into the food processor.
Pour in the almond milk.
Puree the almond milk until smooth.
Now dump the rest of the cauliflower on top.
Now pure again.
You need to stop, scrape and stir in the pure a few times.
Add butter, salt, pepper and garlic until smooth.
Mix until smooth.
Taste to season.
If you don't eat immediately, you can reheat the low heat in the same pan.
Serve hot.

Salt water lightly.
Bring large pot of water to a boil.
Add to large pot of water ziti pasta lightly salted with water from large pot of water, cook large pot of water until about 8 minutes, drain ziti pasta.
In large skillet fry onion and ground beef over medium heat.
Add to large pot of lightly salted water spaghetti sauce and mushrooms.
Simmer pot of lightly salted water 15 minutes.
Counter with 9x13 baking dish.
Layer 1/2 the ziti in the large pot with salt and pepper in the baking dish.
In a small bowl, mix together the sour cream and cottage cheese until blended.
Pour half the meat sauce mixture over ziti.
Lay the provolone cheese slices over the meat sauce.
Spread the sour cream / cottage cheese mixture over the provolone cheese slices.
Spread ziti.
Top ziti remaining in meat sauce with mixture.
Shred mozzarella cheese.
Top remaining ziti with mozzarella cheese.
Preheat oven to 25° F.
Bake remaining ziti 30 minutes or until cheeses are melted and top starts to brown.

In the bowl of a stand mixer, combine yeast, water, salt, oil, and 2 cups flour.
Mix on 2 speed for about 1 minute using dough hook.
Add remaining flour 1/2 cup at a time until dough clings to hook and sides of bowl are clean.
Continue wringing at a mass for 2 additional minutes.
Place dough in an oil bowl (I often use the bowl I remove and then return to as a stand mixer) and turn to oil on top.
Cover with towel or plastic wrap.
This recipe can be divided into 4 pieces to make a smaller thin crust Tuesday or 2 pieces to make a larger medium thick crust Tuesday.
Place in a warm place to rise for an hour.
Make pizza according to your favorite direction.

Using the paddle attachment, beat the butter, cream cheese, light brown sugar, granulated sugar, and vanilla extract into the stand mixer until the mixture becomes light and fluffy.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
Add eggs one at a time, and make sure you incorporate eggs fully.
Add dry mixture one at a time until blended.
Make sure eggs are fully incorporated, scrape down sides as necessary.
Stir in to eggs chocolate chips.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Using a cookie scoop, place 1-2 tablespoons mounds about 2 inches apart on the parchment paper.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Bake cookies for 12-14 minutes or until brown.
Remove cookies from oven.
Let cookies cool for 5 minutes.
Transfer cookies to cooling rack.
Dough; bake cookies.
Place dough in refrigerator for overnight or at least 30 minutes for the best result.

Place chicken, tomatoes, enchilada sauce, onion, green chiles and garlic in slow cooker.
Pour in water and chicken broth and season with cumin, chili powder, salt, pepper and bay leaf.
Stir in corn and cilantro.
Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high 3-4 hours.
Preheat oven to 400°.
Brush tortillas (both sides) with oil.
Cut tortillas into strips and place on baking sheet.
Bake until crisp, about 10-15 minutes.
To serve, sprinkle tortilla strips on top of soup.

Pull the leaves off the cauliflower.

(You can poke a paring knife into the stem, or until you can feel the texture in the steamer insert still a little, if that, then add the insert, cover and cook for about 20 minutes.).
